mcqs.question: What percentage of umbilical hernias undergo spontaneous closure by age 4-5 years in otherwise healthy children?
mcqs.explanation: Approximately 80-90% of umbilical hernias close spontaneously by age 4-5 years, with higher closure rates in smaller defects.

mcqs.question: What is the primary etiology of umbilical hernia?

options.A: Failed involution of the urachus after birth
options.B: Failure of the umbilical ring to close completely after cord separation
options.C: Inflammatory response to minor infection or irritation
options.D: Failure of abdominal wall closure during embryonic development

mcqs.explanation: Umbilical hernia is caused by failure of the umbilical ring to close completely after cord separation.

mcqs.question: What is the incidence of umbilical hernia in preterm infants?
mcqs.explanation: The incidence of umbilical hernia rises to up to 75% in preterm infants.

mcqs.question: What is the success rate of surgical repair for umbilical hernia?
mcqs.explanation: Surgical repair of umbilical hernia has a success rate greater than 95%.

mcqs.question: What is the definition of omphalocele?

options.A: Protrusion of abdominal contents through a patent umbilical ring
options.B: Congenital midline abdominal wall defect with herniation of abdominal organs into a sac covered by peritoneum and amniotic membrane
options.C: Persistence of the embryonic urachus connecting the bladder to the umbilicus
options.D: Overgrowth of granulation tissue at the umbilicus

mcqs.explanation: Omphalocele is defined as a congenital midline abdominal wall defect with herniation of abdominal organs into a sac covered by peritoneum and amniotic membrane.

mcqs.question: What percentage of infants with omphalocele have associated congenital cardiac anomalies?
mcqs.explanation: Approximately 50% of omphalocele cases have associated cardiac anomalies, most commonly atrial or ventricular septal defects.

mcqs.question: What is a common symptom of patent urachus?
mcqs.explanation: A common symptom of patent urachus is umbilical wetness or discharge.

mcqs.question: What is the approximate success rate of silver nitrate cauterization for umbilical granuloma when applied correctly?
mcqs.explanation: Silver nitrate application achieves resolution in approximately 80-90% of umbilical granulomas, typically requiring 1-3 applications.

mcqs.question: What is the success rate of surgical excision for umbilical granuloma?
mcqs.explanation: Surgical excision of umbilical granuloma has a success rate of 100%.

mcqs.question: What is the embryologic origin of omphalocele?

options.B: Failed lateral body fold fusion at 4–6 weeks gestation
options.C: Incomplete fusion of the umbilical ring after cord detachment

mcqs.explanation: Omphalocele results from failed lateral body fold fusion at 4–6 weeks gestation.

mcqs.question: At what age does umbilical granuloma typically peak?
mcqs.explanation: Umbilical granuloma peaks at 1–2 months of age.
